PORTFOLIO BLOG ABOUT RESUME

RESUME

[download print resume as pdf]



Graphic Designer at UT Liberal Arts and Life & Letters Magazine

May '16—Present


  • Designed editorial illustrations for articles in Life and Letters magazine.
  • Created UT branded cards and print media for Liberal Arts Development.
  • Launched an Impact Report in concert with all Liberal Arts departments.



Administrative Assistant at Brenda Thompson Communications

May '16—Dec '16


  • Designed graphics, social media campaigns, and client proposals.
  • Collaborated with prominent Austin businesses such as ThunderCloud Subs, Kerbey Lane Cafe, and Freedom Solar Power.
  • Organized corporate events and worked with event rental contractors in a variety of fields.



Intern at Generous Art

June '14—Aug '14


  • Designed print, web, and branding material for a local non-profit art gallery and arts advocacy group.
  • Managed data and image entry for their website and online store.
  • Proposed resources for a high school arts education program in East Austin.
  • Recorded notes at board member meetings.



Fellow at MINDPOP Fellowship for Creative Leadership

May '14—May '15


  • Developed career skills as one of ten fellows selected for the education non-profit’s program.
  • Explored opportunities in non-profit arts education.
  • Performed community service around Austin.



Lifeguard at Circle C Swim Center

June '14—Jan '16


  • Completed and sustained Red Cross Lifeguard Certification.
  • Maintained pool facilities and equipment hourly.
  • Tested, measured, and handled pool chemicals.
  • Practiced and performed first aid.



Camp Counselor at Lost Pines Boy Scout Camp

May '11—Aug '13


  • Instructed merit badge classes on art, wilderness survival, swimming, and outdoor skills.
  • Maintained indoor and outdoor program areas.
  • Served six meals a day.
  • Provided customer service for parents, teens, and visitors.
